title: Additional Rescissions of Harmful Executive Orders and Actions

enrichment.summary: This executive order cancels a series of prior executive orders, memoranda, and presidential determinations primarily issued under the Biden administration. It aims to rescind actions seen as harmful to federal governance and policy, restoring what the order calls 'common sense' to the federal government. The revoked items cover topics such as public health, national security, labor standards, energy, and biotechnology.
potential_concerns: Removing executive orders related to minimum wage and worker rights could negatively impact labor standards and union protections.
Revoking public health and pandemic response orders might weaken preparedness and response capacity for future health threats.
Cancellation of determinations under the Defense Production Act could disrupt supply chain resilience for critical materials and products.
Eliminating policies aimed at advancing biotechnology and human rights initiatives may stall progress in innovation and social equity.
The broad revocation of multiple prior actions might create legal uncertainty or hinder continuity in federal programs and policies.
